1.text: Choose bean sprouts with a pale color and a crisp, firm texture.

2.text: Store the sprouts in the fridge, separate from raw meat and seafood.

3.text: Buy the bean sprouts just before you want to cook them.

4.text: Rinse the beans with cool, filtered water before you cook them.

5.text: Bring 4 cups (1 L) of water to a boil over medium to high heat.

6.text: Add the bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute and 30 seconds.

7.text: Drain the bean sprouts in a colander.

8.text: Use the bean sprouts in your desired recipe.

9.text: Combine the onion, scallion, sesame seeds, and garlic.

10.text: Stir the sesame oil, soy sauce, and salt into the bowl.

11.text: Toss the dressing with the bean sprouts, then chill for 30 minutes.

12.text: Heat 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of vegetable oil in a skillet.

13.text: Add 1 small chopped onion and fry it for 2 minutes.

14.text: Add 2 cups (200 g) of bean sprouts and season with salt.

15.text: Sauté the bean sprouts over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes.

17.text: Combine the peanut oil, scallions, ginger, and garlic in a wok.

18.text: Fry the ingredients over high heat until they become fragrant.

19.text: Season the ingredients with salt and pepper.

20.text: Add 1 pound (450 g) of bean sprouts and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
